build 20020328

1) Project A is managed by CVS
2) Copy Project A to Project B
3) Find out that the cause of all your headaches is because it copied the CVS 
folders as well
4) Delete CVS folders from Project B (using windows explorer)
5) Select Project B, right click properties->CVS

With team-private folders won't get copied so assume bug can't happen anymore.
Marking fixed since we now have team-private in.

Copying the project seems to also copy the CVS subfolders
and leaves the new project managed just like the old one
which is not what was expected when the bug was marked FIXED.

Must investigate further.
